concept.title: Working with the App Store
concept.shortdesc: The App Store is a collection of ready-to-run applications that can be deployed to in a simple process. The interface uses the same API as the client, pulling the source code from a Git repository rather than pushing an archive from the user's local filesystem.

conbody.note: Application developers have access to the main App Store interface, but do not have access to add new applications or store definitions. For more information, see the Application Developer Guide.

section.title: Creating an App Store
section.p: The App Store interface exposes multiple stores which specify the available applications. These stores are sourced from definition files specified in the main Settings view of the Managsgement Console or set using the kato config command.
